recipe_name: Stir-fried prawns and pak choi with lime, soy and coriander
author: Phil Vickery
method: Heat the sesame and vegetable oils in a wok and fry the onion and chilli for 2-3 minutes. Add the pak choi, lemon, orange and lime juice and zest and soy sauce and cook for a further two minutes, or until the juice is starting to reduce. Add the prawns and cook until they turn pink. Stir in the chopped coriander. To serve, pile the stir-fry onto a serving plate and garnish with the paprika-dipped lime wedges and more coriander.
ingredients: 1 tbsp sesame oil,  1 tbsp vegetable oil,  ½ onion, finely sliced,  1 red chilli, finely chopped,  2 pak choi, finely sliced,  ½ lemon, juice and zest,  ½ orange, juice and zest,  ½ lime, juice and zest,  2 tbsp soy sauce,  3 raw king prawns, shells removed,  3 tbsp chopped fresh coriander,  1 lime, cut into quarters, one side of each dusted with paprika ,  1 small handful coriander leaves
